change.item: Converted from dtd to schema and transformed with AT-import-fixer.xsl

PUBLIC "-//Duke University::David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library//TEXT (US::NDD::::J. Walter Thompson Company. Advertising Vertical Files)//EN" "jwtadvertisingverticalfiles.xml" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.xsl (sy2003-10-15).

Also, the top level of the finding aid (above the dsc) changed to conform to current Rubenstein Library and NC EAD standards as laid out in the Inventory Style Guide and in the NCEAD Best Practice Guidelines. Within the dsc, dates for series were normalized. These changes were made by Michelle Belden.
Also, container TYPE and LABEL attribute values were standardized according to the Rubenstein Library EAD 2002 manual and the NCEAD eadlocal.ent by Ruth E. Bryan.
The tag list inside index was changed to indexentry by Ruth E. Bryan.

Additional boxes (boxes 5A and 5B) added to accession 1999-0420. Minimally processed by Richard Collier on August 2, 2001. Encoded by Richard Collier on August 2, 2001. Date span not changed. Linear feet changed from 51 to 54. Item count changed from 30,600 to 32,400.

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. There may be a 48-hour delay in obtaining these materials.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company Advertising Vertical File, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Advertising Vertical File was transferred to the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library in September 1999.

processinfo.p: This collection is minimally processed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.
Encoded by Lisa Stark and Richard Collier

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company was founded in New York in 1864. The advertising agency's archives document the history, operations, policies, and accomplishments of one of the world's oldest, largest and most innovative advertising firms.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Advertising Vertical File contains subject files on a wide range of advertising topics, and is primarily comprised of news clippings, articles, and pamphlets. Topics range from financial information, legal aspects of marketing, employment trends, awards, information on individuals in the industry, media, packaging, trademarks, and marketing research. The file was created and maintained as an internal reference file by the Information Center in JWT's New York Office. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
